item.title: Ticket #1442 (Patch for applying "posts_join" and "posts_where" to get_next_link() ...) created
item.dc:creator: pejve
item.description:
Patch for applying "posts_join" and "posts_where" to get_next_link() and get_previous_link().

Among other things this is nice for the Category Visibility plugin (which restricts access to certain posts from lower level users).

I hope you like it.

item.description: I had a patch for this laying around. Well, it's for 1.5.1.2 and it applies both "posts_where" and "posts_join". I hope you don't mind. Please be gentle, I'm new here.

item.title: Ticket #1441 (foreach() warning if no post meta) closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
invalid:

Apologies, I was getting post meta confused with user meta. Ran upgrade.php and everything's finished.

item.title: Ticket #1441 (foreach() warning if no post meta) created
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
(latest svn)

If you haven't attached any custom fields to a post, you get a warning at the top of every screen: 

Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /srv/htdocs/wp/wp-includes/functions.php on line 1172

Patch: 

--- functions.php       2005-06-14 13:16:26.887806504 +0100
+++ functions-mod.php   2005-06-14 13:23:04.870303968 +0100
@@ -1169,8 +1169,10 @@
                foreach ($users as $user) :
                        $metavalues = $wpdb->get_results("SELECT meta_key, meta_value FROM $wpdb->usermeta WHERE user_id = '$user->ID'");
-                       foreach ( $metavalues as $meta )
-                               $user->{$meta->meta_key} = $meta->meta_value;
+                       if ($metavalues) {
+                               foreach ( $metavalues as $meta )
+                                       $user->{$meta->meta_key} = $meta->meta_value;
+                       }
                        $cache_userdata[$user->ID] = $user;
                        $cache_userdata[$user->user_login] =& $cache_userdata[$user->ID];
                endforeach;

item.title: Ticket #1438 (Language element in wp-rss2.php is empty, making the feed invalid) closed
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
invalid:

The only way this could be caused is if someone updates from an old version and does not run upgrade.php. You can fix the site by opening upgrade.php in yoru browser, as I just did.

item.title: Ticket #1438 (Language element in wp-rss2.php is empty, making the feed invalid) updated
item.dc:creator: stonecobra
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #1438 (Language element in wp-rss2.php is empty, making the feed invalid) created
item.dc:creator: stonecobra
item.description:
​http://feedvalidator.org/check.cgi?url=http://totalsync.com/blog/feed

While the language element is optional, when it does exist it helps to have a value. I noticed ticket number 862 ​http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/862 talking about it, but it was marked as closed/fixed in version 1.5 in Feb 2005

This blog is using WordPress 1.5.1.2 (latest as of now), and the problem remains.

Please note that you do not have a version selector for 1.5.1.2
